reviews.review: a little bit edgy when it comes to its political/religious stances, but beyond that its a great action thriller and a puzzling mystery through the  whole experience

One of my all time favorite shooters. The story is one of the best I have seen and the game mechanics work beautifuly. The best part is how well it immerses you in the scene. Having a character that is with you at all times is also great for the solo gamer who trys to immagine having friends.
Just forty minutes into what is a seemingly beautiful utopia in the clouds... Let's just say, the amount of light that is present in this game can be reflected into just as much darkness.
Muy buen juego

Ich weiß nicht wo ich bei diesem genialem Spiel anfangen soll. ICh war schon damals ein Fan der reihe,aber Infinite hat mir erst gezeigt was die Leute bei 2K wirklich können.

ICh habe Bioshock Infinite  2x auf Hard und 1x Im 1999/Hardcore-Modus gespielt.

Die präsentation aller Genies und Wahnsinnigen war in Bioshock schon immer sehr kreativ und rund um sehr Atmosphärisch verpackt,doch Infinite legt ene Schippe drauf. Der Stil ist sehr Comic lastig,dies ermöglicht aber die Gute Grafik und wunderschöne Szenerie.Anhänger des Steampunk sind hier sehr gut aufgehoben.Die Zahlreichen Kongurenten und Gegnertypen sind größten teils individuell aber auch in Infinite wie auch bei den Vorgängern liegt die Stärke in der Präsentation der Welt und CHaraktere.Damals war es Andrew Ryan und Rapture und Jetzt ist es Commstock und Columbia.Die Steuerung ist On-Point man muss lediglich mich dem rückstoß einiger Waffen zurechtkommen, ansonsten trifft man immer dass was man unter der Linse hat.Bei der Story möchte ich keinem was vorweg nehmen ich sage dazu nur:" Konstanten und Variablen".

2K hat ihre Erfahrungen aus den Vorgängern in diesem Teil ernet gut untergebracht. Bioshock Infinite ist ein völlig neues Abenteuer mit der gewohnten Atmospäre zwischen Genie und Wahnsinn einen platz zu suchen.
Yeah this game is fucking awesome!

BioShock Infinite เป็นเกม FPS ที่มีการนำเสนอเนื้อเรื่องค่อนข้างดี โดยเกี่ยวกับทฤษฎีโลกคู่ขนาน ซึ่งอธิบาย ยากไปหน่อย เล่นตอนแรกอาจ งงๆ ว่าเนื้อเรื่องคืออะไร แต่หลังจะรู้ว่าเป็นเนื้อเรื่องที่เราคาดไม่ถึง
ถ้าเล่นแต่ไม่สนใจเนื้อเรื่องหลังๆอาจดูน่าเบื่อ ผมจึงแนะนำให้เสพเนื้อเรื่องดีกว่า
ทางด้าน Gameplay เกมนี้เป็นเกม FPS ที่ต่างออกไปเพราะเราจะไม่ได้ ยิง อย่างเดียวแต่เราจะมีพลังให้ใช้ด้วย เช่น ไฟ น้ำ
ทางด้าน Graphic นั้นถือว่าทำออกมาค่อนข้างดี

Bioshock stworzone przez studio Irrational Games należy do tych gier w które warto zagrać. Zawiera ona w sobie intrygującą fabułe, przyzwoity system walk, a przede wszystkim genialnie nakreślony świat jakim jest Columbia. 

   Miasto w chmurach nie stanowi tylko tła dla fabuły, w której mamy, kierując detektywem Bookerem DeWitt odnaleźć zaginioną kobietę Elizabeth. 
   Columbia sama w sobie jest świetnym przykładem antyutopii, w której obraz majestatycznie sunących po niebie sterowców i bajkowym wyglądem miasta kontrastuje z ksenofobią, rasizmem i ślepym kultem jednostki jej mieszkańców. 
   Co więcej Booker oraz Elizabeth stanowią dobrze napisane postacie, z którymi poznawanie fabuły tylko nabiera smaku. Dodatkowo bajkowa, nieco cukierkowa, choć miła dla oka oprawa wizualna dobrze służy w poznawaniu tej alternatywnej rzeczywistości świata rozgrywki.
    Muzyka w grze jest dobrze dobrana, występują w niej utwory charakterystyczne dla okresu, w którym toczy się rozgrywka, co grze bardzo służy. 

   Do rzeczy, które mogą uprzykrzyć rozgrywkę to choćby problem z niewidzialnymi ścianami czy niestarannie wykonane tekstury niektórych przedmiotów. 
   Mimo, że Bioshock to gra akcji, to w ostatnich fazach rozgrywki kolejne hordy wrogów do pokonania, stojące na drodze do poznania fabuł potrafiły mnie nieco nudzić, a system walki mógłby być nieco lepszy. 
   Grę przy pierwszym podejściu przeszedłem na poziomie trudnym i ten poziom właśnie polecam.

Bioshock Infinite is absolutely a brilliant masterpiece. I admired every aspect of this game. For example, I love how this game allowed you to  learn so much about the characters through the audio diaries that are provided with exploration. 

The gameplay was not a drastic improvement over the past Bioshock games, but it was still very fun. I did like how they incorporated new aspects into the game such as the skylines. There were many weapons to choose from and a decent variety of customization. I was also very glad that my ally was not completely useless for once, as Elizabeth helped me a lot throughout the whole game (handing ammo and money for example). 

My favorite part of this game was the storyline, which in my opinion is one of the best I've seen in a video game (despite a few plot holes). The character development was great, I really felt the growing relationship between Booker and Elizabeth as the game progressed. 

Be sure to buy the Burial At Sea DLC if you buy this game too, it is well worth it and definitely more of a challenge to complete compared to the original game.

A franquia Bioshock é a minha favorita de todos os tempos, especialmente Bioshock Infinite e suas DLCs, que me deixaram boquiaberto do início ao fim. Artes impecáveis, jogabilidade ótima e toda a questão de fendas interdimensionais te deixam com vontade de ter um jogo para cada uma das existentes. Franquia inspirada em Atlas Shrugged, livro que por consequência se tornou meu favorito, Bioshock Infinite é uma obra de arte em forma de jogo, ver a saga de um lado nunca visto antes e, finalmente, entender o quanto esse jogo pode ser inovador em relação a plot twists, me deixou admirado e chocado por dias a fio.

В эту замечательную игру должен поиграть каждый. Редко встретишь настолько хорошие игры с таким хорошим сюжетом, также рекомендую пройти 2 дополнения к этой игре. Лично я прошёл все 3 части BioShock, и очень жаль, что группа разработчиков распалась. Вобщем, кто не играл обязательно купите!

I wanted to like BioShock Infinite, I really did. An apparent utopia in the clouds, like something from the mind of Jules Verne and then later, George Orwell. It's a world that in the first act of the game we get revealed to us, piece by unsettling piece. This is where the game is at its strongest; a passive exploratory wander along cobbled streets as buildings rise and fall beside you, bathed in glorious sunshine. Each turn in your path reveals another fascinating vista; a floating carnival, a barbershop quartet on a levitating barge, or the magnificent Battleship Bay. Whilst somewhat open to explore, the narrative carefully ushers you, quite happily, onwards along a defined path through the city. As you descend into the heart of its industrial core, its dystiopian underpinnings mount ominously before you.

Infinite’s city inspires such fascination, that it comes as a huge disappointment to find you will end up disconnecting from the experience behind a barrage of muzzle flash. Infinite, from relatively early on shows its true colors as a FPS romp akin to Wolfenstein, or indeed previous entries in the series; with abundant health packs, and other pickups, set-piece battlegrounds with spawning cover, and corridor action. It’s not that Infinite does this poorly, in fact the combat flows beautifully, weapons have punch, and the exploding heads of enemies prompt a satisfying orchestra hit! The problem is it just get’s old really fast. There is no mission variety, there’s no real interaction with this incredible city, and as you get deeper into the story, and sun descends into brooding darkness, the environment narrows and feels a little too functional as visceral combat devise. 

At this point, the narrative is the only thing keeping everything tied together, but even that grows stale as we are lead through plot twist, after plot twist. It’s natural crescendo is reached early in the third act, and from there, the player simply guns their way into a final set of nauseating twists that seem to make even Comstock’s beard whiten with frustration. 

The Last of Us is a good example of how a linear narrative can be done right; take an interesting backdrop and use a good narrative and mission variety to allow the player to not only walk through the world, but feel part of it. I even wanted to take it further; I wanted to talk to the inhabitants of the city, hell I wanted to be one; trade and explore, maybe start a shop. I think I wanted a different game, and to 2K and Irrational’s credit, they helped me dream big through such an inventive world. But then to shackle my experience to a restrictive and repetitive FPS game feels overwhelmingly disappointing. I wish the game itself was as ambitious as Comstock’s floating city.

This game is extremely fun if you are into first person shooters. The prequel to this game was my first fps and really got me into playing this genre alot more. Bioshock Infinite provides the player with a vast assortment of weapons and various amounts of abilities. This allows the game to stay fresh while going back in forth into combat may seem repetitive as you go place to place killing enemies. Although the gameplay may seem repetive I believe you will come to enjoy the story that is being told throughout this game and this is I why I would recommend this game to anyone who loves first person shooters.

This game is a masterpeice, the grpahics are really really nice and can run beautifully even on my not-so-good grpahics card. At the start the game makes sense, find the girl to wipe away the debt then around mid game it begins to get complicated whether it be because i wasn't the most attentive to voxophones or became confused with dialogue but then at the end of the game everything makes sense. The gameplay is great and i thoroughly enjoyed the whole experience. 

the downside however would be, the fact that the game would've ended in about 3-4 hours if silly plot twists didn't happen, especially around the 3-4 hour mark. These plot twists happened way too much and I felt like Booker "I have done everything, i don't need to know about your [spoiler]finger[/spoiler] can't we just go to Paris?". If you came to this game for Bioshock im just saying Big Daddy makes no appearance and judging by the reviews of people who've played the series, it is not very similar to Bioshock. It could've easily been a standalone game with a cameo.

9/10 
-1 for plot twists frequency and sometimes confusing story moments

EDIT:
Ok guys, it's been a week and I wish I could play the game but i can't because the story ends. Grrrrrrr. I keep opening my library and going to play it then a wave of sadness comes over me.

Set in a mysterious and incredibly imaginative world, every Answer breeds new questions, spinning an incredible story that comes together quite nicely in an ending that blew my mind. I wish I could forget everything and play it again!

I bought this game because i liked the first one.

Why did i like the first one.
The gameplay and gunplay was decent.
But was really hooked me was the story and awesome setting, Rapture: a city underwarter.

In Infinite the setting, a city in the sky, seemed interesting and unique at first but its way too shallow.
In the first one they put a lot of effort in making a city underwater somewhat believable.
( It is still a videogame so we let some things slide ... ) but in Infinite it doesnt fit at all.
They explain in one senctence somewhere why everything could fly.

Superpowers: Plasmide vs Vigor
In Rapture there were superpowers called plasmide.
They fitted into the universe they created. A lot of enemies used them and they were tied in with the story.
In Infinite there are all these superpowers, now called vigors, laying around, yet nobody execpt of one or two enemies seems to use them.

SPOILERS:
When did the game lose me:
when they introduced the reality, space and time changing.
The girl we are rescuing can use Tears to rip in dimensional time and space
There are just way to many and way to big plot holes in it. To the point where i didnt really care about it anymore.
The last few hours were a drag... it hoped the ending would smooth things out a bit, but left me disappointed.

Botton Line:
If you dont like most timetravel Movies, chances are pretty high that you will not like this game.
If you played bioshock 1/2, buy the season pass, -10/10 regrets

A real masterpiece.

BioShock Infinite is one of those games you'll remember for a while after you played it. There are so many reasons that make this game wonderful that I'll probably forget some of them: the graphics are beautiful, the world is gorgeous, the sounds are good, the narrating is awesome, and the character development is nearly perfect !

Infinite, just like the other BioShocks, has a lot of unique gameplay features with spells, one of the character helping you (No spoilers), as well as a lot of other original stuff. 

Even though the game is extremly well made and interesting, I see a few issues in some of the sections of the game. A few times in the game I found myself pretty annoyed having to replay a section of the game over and over, but in different places, and iterating some gameplay elements can be frustrating when you're forced to.

This game is definetly worth it ! I recommand getting it on sales in a bundle where you can get the 3 BioShock games for less than 10€, defintely a great deal. BioShock is an amazing game that you HAVE to play !

BioShock Infinite is a great improvement to the previous BioShock games. Though the main game does not transpire in the well-known city known as Rapture, Columbia, the sky city, is almost as good. Spanning a long story and many secrets to find, this game is going to be something to play for a while. If you just rush through the story, then the game may take you 15 hours. That is at least doubled if you try to find all the collectibles in the game. The actual shooting is very smooth. This is also a good game for a controller on PC, alongside the other BioShock games. If you do want to play in Rapture,  however, there is the DLC to buy and then you can explore the underwater city. I have not bought it, so I do not know how awesome it is. The story in the game is also very great. I will not explain it, however, because that may spoil the experience. Just remember this quote, though: "Bring us the girl, and wipe away the debt."

The only con to this game is the somewhat repetitive gameplay. Shoot people. Progress. Shoot more people. Progress. Shoot even more people. Progress.

SCORE: 96/100

CONCLUSION
Story-lovers and FPS-lovers should all try this game out, as it packs the best of both worlds.

Bioshock Infinite - это
Атмосферный шутер от первого лица с глубоким сюжетом. Эта игра очень красива, не смотря не на что, оптимизация тоже хороша.Наверно единственная игра которую я прошел от начала и до конца не то что не разу не заскучав.
Оценка :
[Сюжет] 9/10 
[Геймплей] 9/10 
[Графика и Оптимизация] 10/10
[Музыка , Звуки и Озвучка] 10/10
[Погружение в Игру] 10/10
(9,6 / 10)

Ich muss mal vorab sagen......EXTREM GEILES SPIEL!!!

Also zum Thema Story kann ich nur sagen,Bombastisch,regt auch sehr zum Nachdenken an,vor allem nach dem Ende saß ich mindestens 3 Stunden da und musste nachdenken was genau da jetzt passiert ist.

Vom Gameplay is das Spiel untere Spitzenklasse,da es meiner Meinung irgendwann etwas monoton wird,aber das ist auch nicht so schlimm bei dieser bombastischen Story.Es ist aber auch mit einigen netten Ideen gefüllt wie zum Beispiel 
Elizabeth,die einen mit Sachen versorgt die sie findet(wie zum Beispiel Medipacks oder Munition).Insgesammt ist das Gameplay ein guter Shooter mit RPG einschlag und einigen super ideen wie zum Beispiel Elizabeth.

Zum Thema Sound und Grafik kann man nicht viel sagen,die Sprecher sing extrem gut,Waffen und Effekte hören sich auch sehr gut an(vielleicht ein bisschen zu wenig Wums,is aber verkraftbar).Der Soundtrack bedient sich an berühmten Stücken z.B. das Requiem von Mozart,und weiteren Klassischen Orchesterstücken.Zum Thema Grafik kann ich sagen,sie tuht seinen Job mit stimmigen Umgebungen und guten Animationen und Effekten,ist aber nich zu vergleichen mit einem Witcher 3 oder so(würde aber auch meiner Meinung nach nicht dazu passen,da es einen eigenen sehr stilsicheren comichaften Look hat).Aber wenn man bedenkt das es jetzt schon 2 Jahre auf dem Buckel hat,sieht es sehr gut aus.Es ist bei mir auch nicht einmal in meiner ganzen Spielzeit abgestürzt und lief einwandfrei.

Zum Vergleich zu den Vorgängern kann ich nichts sagen,da ich sie nicht gespielt habe.

Als Fazit kann ich sagen,ein muss wenn ihr auf Shooter mit guter Story steht und ein paar neue Ideen mögt.Es ist auf jeden Fall eine Empfehlung,wenn ihr insgesammt auf Shooter steht.

PS:Ich habe jetzt nicht so auf die Rechtschreibung geachtet :),hoffe aber das man alles lesen kann.

Ich kann nur sagen GEILES SPIEL!!!
